# Dagger Badge

![Dagger](https://img.shields.io/badge/dynamic/json?label=Dagger&query=%24.engineVersion&link=%3Cbound%20method%20DaggerBadge.link%20of%20DaggerBadge%28segment_prefix%3D%27%21%5BDagger%5D%27%2C%20img_shield_link%3D%27https%3A%2F%2Fimg.shields.io%2Fbadge%2Fdynamic%2Fjson%27%2C%20raw_url%3D%27https%3A%2F%2Fraw.githubusercontent.com%2Fpjmagee%2Fdagger-badge%2Fmain%2Fdagger.json%27%29%3E&url=https%3A%2F%2Fraw.githubusercontent.com%2Fpjmagee%2Fdagger-badge%2Fmain%2Fdagger.json&logo=data%3Aimage%2Fsvg%2Bxml%3Bbase64%2CPHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIGlkPSJDYWxxdWVfNSIgdmlld0JveD0iMCAwIDIyMS4xMDIgMjIxLjEwMiI%2BPGRlZnM%2BPHN0eWxlPi5jbHMtNHtmaWxsOiNiZTFkNDN9LmNscy01e2ZpbGw6IzEzMTIyNn0uY2xzLTZ7ZmlsbDojNDBiOWJjfTwvc3R5bGU%%%%2BPC9zdmc%2B)

## Description

This creates a shields.io badge for your dagger project.

## Example output

```markdown
[![Dagger Badge](https://img.shields.io/endpoint?url=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/username/repo/main/dagger.json)](https://dagger.dev)
```

## Usage example

```
dagger call -m https://github.com/pjmagee/dagger-badge --raw-url=https://example.host/raw-path-to-your/dagger.json link
```
